dbms.parser
Class SQLParser

java.lang.Object
  dbms.parser.SQLParser

public class SQLParser
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements a Parser for SQL-92.It doesn't yet support the "not equal" operator as well as the '(' & ')' that alter the priority of the operations.

Version:
0.95
Author:
Skalistis Stefanos

Method Detail

parseCommands

public java.lang.String parseCommands(java.lang.String BatchofCommands)
The parseCommands method checks if a command is in the valid format and if so it parses it using the parse command in order to recognise what sort of command it is.

Parameters:
BatchofCommands -
Returns:
String

getNextLexicalUnit

private java.lang.String getNextLexicalUnit()
This method determines the next lexical unit from the character array that our system has to read and then it tries to match it with one of the SQLPatterns our system recognises. If the format does not match the one described in the pattern the appropriate error is printed. If it does matches the patters, the lexical unit is being split from the string in order to be recognised.

Returns:
String
See Also:
SQLPatterns

recognizeLexicalUnit

private SQLTokens recognizeLexicalUnit(java.lang.String lexicalUnit)
This method matches the lexical unit it takes as a parameter with an SQL token she knows (@see SQLTOkens). If it cannot be matched with anyone of these tokens it labels the lexical unit as unknown.

Parameters:
lexicalUnit -
Returns:
SQLTokens

parseCreateTable

private void parseCreateTable()
If a create table query has been recognised from the parse method, parseCreateTable method executes the command by calling the appropriate method implemented to Main class after it has check the insert into from query's format to be as it should. If it is not in a valid format, it returns a message that marks the error found

parseCreateIndex

private void parseCreateIndex()
If a create index query has been recognised from the parse method, the parseCreateIndex method executes the command by calling the appropriate method implemented to Main class after it has check the insert into from query's format to be as it should. If it is not in a valid format, it returns a message that marks the error found

parseSelect

private void parseSelect()
If a select query has been recognised from the parse method, parseSelect method executes the command by calling the appropriate method implemented to Main class after it has check the insert into from query's format to be as it should. If it is not in a valid format, it returns a message that marks the error found

parseInsertInto

private void parseInsertInto()
If an insert query has been recognised from the parse method, parseInsertInto method executes the command by calling the appropriate method implemented to Main class after it has check the insert into from query's format to be as it should. If it is not in a valid format, it returns a message that marks the error found

parseDeleteFrom

private void parseDeleteFrom()
If a delete query has been recognised from the parse method, parseDeleteFrom method executes the command by calling the appropriate method implemented to Main class after it has check the delete from query's format to be as it should. If it is not in a valid format, it returns a message that marks the error found

parseDropIndex

private void parseDropIndex()
If a drop index query has been recognised from the parse method, parseDropIndex method executes the command by calling the appropriate method implemented to Main class

parse

private void parse()
The parse method tries to match the command that was given to her with one of the commands that our DBMS system supports. If it succeed then it looks if the whole statement has the appropriate format and if so it calls the appropriate method to execute the given query. If the query is not recognised an appropriate message is shown to the user

printError

private void printError(java.lang.String expected,
                        java.lang.String found)
Returns a message to the user if another lexical unit's type appear where something else was expected.

Parameters:
expected -
found -
